#Text=Glossop
#Text=Glossop is a small town located on the edge of the Peak District .
#Text=It lies in the county of Derbyshire , which is officially part of the East Midlands ( though most residents would consider themselves part of the Northwest of England ) .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Glossop is at the northwestern extremity of Derbyshire and the Peak District , close to the borders with Greater Manchester and Yorkshire .
#Text=It also lies at the start of two of the most infamous Pennine passes , the Snake and Woodhead passes .

#Text=Its main development is owed to the 19th-century cotton industry which generated the wealth to build much of the town we see today , although the cotton industry has since declined and almost disappeared from the region .

#Text=Despite this , the historic mill buildings still dominate the town , such as those at Wren Nest and Howardtown , both of which are undergoing major transformations into new multi-use buildings including retail , leisure and residential .

#Text=Glossop is predominantly a commuter town for the nearby conurbation of Greater Manchester , where quite often people have moved to enjoy a more relaxed and laid-back quality of life whilst enjoying the benefits of living near a city .
#Text=It has a regular market , the usual range of high street chain stores and some independent shops .

#Text=It attracts tourists mainly due to its good transport links with the surrounding Peak District National Park and its stunning countryside , though the town itself is not without interest and parts ( e.g. Manor Park , Old Glossop ) are quite attractive .
#Text=It is not of any administrative significance due to its geographic location and local government structures .
#Text=The population of the town ( 2001 Census ) is 32,428 .
#Text=By train
#Text=There are trains to from Manchester Piccadilly station every 30 minutes and seven days a week .
#Text=The stations on the line are as follows :
#Text=Hadfield
#Text=Glossop
#Text=Dinting
#Text=Broadbottom
#Text=Hattersley
#Text=Godley
#Text=Newton ( for Hyde ) - Connections : Hyde by bus or a 15-minute walk
#Text=Flowery Field
#Text=Guide
#Text=Bridge -
#Text=Connections : Ashton-under-Lyne
#Text=by bus
#Text=Gorton
#Text=Ashburys - Connections : walk or bus to Eastlands/Manchester City FC
#Text=Ardwick - only 1 train Mon – Fri stops
#Text=Manchester Piccadilly
#Text=At peak periods the trains may stop at the following stops in a different order ( i.e. Glossop – Hadfield – Dinting ) .
#Text=This rail service is operated by Northern Rail ; the journey between Glossop and Manchester Piccadilly is around 30 minutes , but journey times may vary at peak periods .
#Text=Visit www.northernrail.org for timetable or call National Rail Enquiries on 0845 748 4950 .
#Text=By bus
#Text=There is an extensive public transport network across the High Peak , which is unusual for a rural area .
#Text=Bus services in Glossop are as follows :
#Text=High Peak buses , ☏ +18435236036 .
#Text=61 Glossop – Hayfield – New Mills — Whaley Bridge – Buxton
#Text=64
#Text=Glossop – Hayfield – New Mills – Whaley Bridge – Macclesfield
#Text=390
#Text=Shire Hill Hospital – Glossop – Whitfield
#Text=393 Padfield – Glossop – Shirebrook Park Circular
#Text=394
#Text=Glossop – Gamesley – Marple – Stepping Hill Hospital
#Text=Stagecoach
#Text=237
#Text=Glossop – Hadfield – Mottram – Stalybridge – Ashton-under-Lyne – Droylsden – Manchester Piccadilly
#Text=358 Glossop – Hayfield – Marple – Offerton – Stockport
#Text=For times , fares and details of these services and how to use them to get to Glossop , call Traveline on 0871 200 2233 .
#Text=The above services below are correct as of 06/01/08 ; please note that some of them operate only on Sundays , or weekends , or evenings ; check before travelling .

#Text=National Express Coaches stop at nearby Hollingworth ; here you can pick up their 350 service towards Manchester and Liverpool , or in the opposite direction towards Sheffield , Nottingham and East Anglia .
#Text=For times , fares and other service information contact National Express on 0870 580 80 80 .
#Text=By car
#Text=Glossop has connections in all directions to the UK road network ; however , the main road ( though not a primary route ) is the A57 .

#Text=To the West this joins with the A628 Woodhead pass at Hollingworth , to become a primary route and then it is a short distance until it meets the UK motorway network via the M67 to allow quick and easy access into Greater Manchester .
#Text=To the East is the A57 Snake Pass , an infamous transpennine pass to Sheffield .

#Text=To the south the main road is the A624 which goes to Hayfield , Chapel-en-le-Frith and eventually Buxton via the A6 ; this is the main route into Derbyshire and towards the towns and cities of the East Midlands .
#Text=To the North is the B6105 which links to the A628 Woodhead Pass at Crowden :
#Text=the A628 is the easiest route to access the M1 from Glossop via Junction 37 at Barnsley .
#Text=The A628 , however , goes through Barnsley and to Pontefract in West Yorkshire .
#Text=By plane
#Text=The airports easily accessible from Glossop are :
#Text=Manchester Airport
#Text=Liverpool John Lennon
#Text=Both can be reached by train via regular services to Manchester Piccadilly , or by car via the motorway network .
#Text=Other airports within 1.5 hours ' drive are :
#Text=Leeds Bradford International
#Text=Robin Hood Airport
#Text=Doncaster Sheffield Airport
#Text=East Midlands Airport
#Text=However , Manchester , being the largest of nearby airports , can usually offer appropriate services from wherever in the world you wish to travel .
#Text=See
#Text=Wren Nest Mill , High Street West .
#Text=Remaining building of cotton mill built between 1800 and 1818 .
#Text=Ardotalia ( Melandra Castle ) , Melandra Castle Rd , Gamesley .
#Text=Site of Roman fort
#Text=Do
#Text=Walk through Manor Park to Old Glossop and — for the energetic — continue onto the slopes of Bleaklow .
#Text=Longdendale Trail .
#Text=An all-purpose trail housed on a disused railway line , about 7 miles from Hadfield to Woodhead featuring trails for bicycles , horses and walkers .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Partington Players Theatre , Henry Street SK13 8BW , ☏ +441457852066 , ✉ partingtonweb@googlemail.com .
#Text=A 120-seat theatre in the centre of Glossop showing plays for a week 6 times each season .
#Text=They also have occasional live music , films and visiting productions .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Glossop boasts some of the best shopping in the High Peak .
#Text=It has a variety of national chain stores and independent stores existing alongside each other in the town centre .
#Text=The largest supermarket is a Tesco store on the main road through the town .
#Text=Major retail areas include the nearby High Street West and Wrens Nest Retail Park , which contains shops such as Next , Argos , Wickes ( DIY ) , Brantano and others .
#Text=The new Howardtown development on the A624 ( Victoria St ) offers additional retail opportunities .
